noun.description: A light sandal, typically of plastic or rubber, with a thong between the big and second toe.
A switching circuit which works by changing from one stable state to another, or through an unstable state back to its stable state, in response to a triggering pulse.

verb.description: Move with a flapping sound or motion.
examples: she flip-flopped off the porch in battered sneakers

verb.description: Make an abrupt reversal of policy.
examples: the candidate flip-flopped on a number of issues

origin: Mid 17th century (in the general sense something that flaps or flops): imitative reduplication of flop.
